question: Will the median person on Bloomberg's Billionaires Index be from the United States on March 20, 2025?
reasoning:
Based on the information gathered, here are some key points relevant to the question:

1. **Bloomberg Billionaires Index**: The index is updated daily and reflects changes in the markets and economy. As of December 28, 2025, the 250th-ranked person was Scott Duncan from the United States. This suggests that, at least recently, the median billionaire was from the U.S.

2. **Wealth Distribution Trends**: The World Wealth Report and other sources indicate that there have been significant changes in wealth distribution, with a concentration of wealth among a few individuals, many of whom are based in the U.S. The presence of U.S.-based tech and financial billionaires is particularly strong.

3. **Economic and Political Influence**: There is a notable influence of billionaires in the U.S. government and economy, with many of the world's richest individuals being from the U.S. This suggests a strong likelihood that U.S. billionaires will continue to hold significant positions on the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

Given these factors, the probability that the median person on Bloomberg's Billionaires Index will be from the United States on March 20, 2025, is relatively high. The current trends and recent data support the likelihood of a U.S. individual holding the 250th position.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.75

The Bloomberg Billionaires Index is a daily ranking of the world’s richest people. Details about
the calculations are provided in the net worth analysis on each billionaire’s profile page. The figures are
updated at the close of every trading day in New York.

Methodology: The Bloomberg Billionaires Index is a daily ranking of the world's richest
people. In calculating net worth, Bloomberg News strives to provide the most transparent calculations available,
and each individual billionaire profile contains a detailed analysis of how that person's fortune is tallied.

The index is a dynamic measure of personal wealth based on changes in markets, the economy and
Bloomberg reporting. Each net worth figure is updated every business day after the close of trading in New York.
Stakes in publicly traded companies are valued using the share's most recent closing price. Valuations are
converted to U.S. dollars at current exchange rates... Read
our complete methodology →

search_results.title: https://www.clubofrome.org/blog-post/korten-billionaires/
search_results.content:
---
title: When billionaires rule the world - A global threat to a viable human future - Club of Rome
author: David Korten; Member; President
url: https://www.clubofrome.org/blog-post/korten-billionaires/
hostname: clubofrome.org
description: 29 January 2025 -
sitename: Club of Rome
date: 2025-01-29
---
29 January 2025 – We have a billionaire problem.

Back in 1995, when I published *When Corporations Rule the World*, there was an awakening to the dangers of transnational corporations. Right now, in 2025, there is an awakening to the dangers of oligarchy—when a few billionaires rule the world. In his farewell speech, outgoing President Biden left us with this warning:

*Today, an oligarchy is taking shape in America of extreme wealth, power and influence that literally threatens our entire democracy, our basic rights and freedoms, and a fair shot for everyone to get ahead. We see the consequences all across America.*

When my book warning of the corporate problem was released in 1995, the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) had recently passed, followed by the formation of the World Trade Organization (WTO). The world began to realise that for-profit corporations were surpassing democratic governments as society’s most powerful governing institutions. The book quickly became an international bestseller.

The extraordinary information technology breakthroughs since 1995 produced the billionaires who currently control them. The world is now witnessing [an alliance](https://abcnews.go.com/US/trump-tapped-unprecedented-13-billionaires-top-administration-roles/story?id=116872968) of tech and financial billionaires that has taken control of the administrative, judicial, and legislative branches of the world’s most powerful government.

Their clear intention is to use that control to defend and further advance their personal monetary interests in disregard of consequences for the wellbeing of Earth and society—and especially the interests of members of the struggling working class whose votes put the billionaires in power. We must use this latest awakening to create a deeply democratic future free of extremes of wealth and power.

Following World War II, the world arrived at a significant moment of opportunity when decolonisation spawned a temporary global burst of democracy and a drive to create and share prosperity equitably on a global scale. The commitment to economic development sparked hope that assets and power would henceforth be democratically sh…

[Truncated preview: showing 358 words out of ~1306. Full content available via `btf_extract_evidence`.]

facts.fact: The article mentions that the five richest men in the world more than doubled their combined fortunes from $405 billion to $869 billion since 2020.

facts.title: https://www.clubofrome.org/blog-post/korten-billionaires/
facts.fact: The article highlights that there is an incoming U.S. administration staffed by billionaires, indicating a strong presence of wealthy individuals in the U.S. government.

facts.title: https://www.clubofrome.org/blog-post/korten-billionaires/
facts.fact: The article discusses the control of information and digital infrastructure by corporations like Google, Microsoft, Space X, Tesla, Amazon, and Meta, which are primarily U.S.-based.

facts.title: https://www.clubofrome.org/blog-post/korten-billionaires/
facts.fact: The article notes that there is an awakening to the dangers of oligarchy, particularly in the United States, where billionaires have significant influence.

facts.title: https://www.clubofrome.org/blog-post/korten-billionaires/
facts.fact: The article suggests that redistributing the financial wealth of billionaires has become a defining priority, indicating the concentration of wealth among a few individuals, many of whom are likely from the U.S.

messages.content:
Based on the following question, analyze it carefully and provide your probability estimate.

Question: Will the median person on Bloomberg's Billionaires Index be from the United States on March 20, 2025?
Background: On December 28, 2025, the 250th-ranked name on the list was Scott Duncan of the United States.
Resolution criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if the person ranked 250th on the Bloomberg Billionaires Index (available at [this link](https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires/)) is listed as being from the United States, when accessed by Metaculus Admins on or after March 22, 2025. It resolves as **No** if the 250th-ranked person is from any other country.
Fine print: For purposes of this question, the "median" from the question's title is defined as the 250th ranked person on the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, no matter how many are on the list.
present_date: 2025-03-01T11:26:31.016896


Make sure to use the tools at your disposal to gather relevant information before providing your final probability estimate.

You may reason through the problem, but you MUST end your response with:
FINAL PROBABILITY: [your decimal number between 0 and 1]

It resolves as **No** if the 250th-ranked person is from any other country.","fine_print":"For purposes of this question, the \"median\" from the question's title is defined as the 250th ranked person on the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, no matter how many are on the list.","present_date":"2025-03-01T11:26:31.016896"}

messages.content:
{"url": "https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires/", "snippet": "---
title: Bloomberg Billionaires Index
author: Brian Chappatta; Tom Maloney; Jack Witzig; Pei Yi Mak; Andrew Heathcote
url: https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires/
hostname: bloomberg.com
description: Follow the money.
sitename: Bloomberg
date: 2017-03-01
tags: ['billionaires, richest people in the world, wealthiest people, Bloomberg Billionaire Index, wealth, richest people list, wealthiest people in the world, fortunes, global elite, income inequality, net worth, inherited money', 'billionaires, richest people in the world, wealthiest people, Bloomberg Billionaire Index, wealth, richest people list, wealthiest people in the world, fortunes, global elite, income inequality, net worth, inherited money']
---
The Bloomberg Billionaires Index is a daily ranking of the world’s richest people. Details about
the calculations are provided in the net worth analysis on each billionaire’s profile page. The figures are
updated at the close of every trading day in New York.

Methodology: The Bloomberg Billionaires Index is a daily ranking of the world's richest
people. In calculating net worth, Bloomberg News strives to provide the most transparent calculations available,
and each individual billionaire profile contains a detailed analysis of how that person's fortune is tallied.

The index is a dynamic measure of personal wealth based on changes in markets, the economy and
Bloomberg reporting. Each net worth figure is updated every business day after the close of trading in New York.
Stakes in publicly traded companies are valued using the share's most recent closing price. Valuations are
converted to U.S. dollars at current exchange rates... Read
our complete methodology →", "word_count": 241, "snippet_word_count": 241, "snippet_truncated": false, "date_cutoff_start": "2025-02-01T11:26:31.016896", "date_cutoff_end": "2025-03-02T11:26:31.016896", "cached_at": "2025-10-24T06:03:19.995740"}

messages.content:
{"url": "https://www.clubofrome.org/blog-post/korten-billionaires/", "snippet": "---
title: When billionaires rule the world - A global threat to a viable human future - Club of Rome
author: David Korten; Member; President
url: https://www.clubofrome.org/blog-post/korten-billionaires/
hostname: clubofrome.org
description: 29 January 2025 -
sitename: Club of Rome
date: 2025-01-29
---
29 January 2025 – We have a billionaire problem.

Back in 1995, when I published *When Corporations Rule the World*, there was an awakening to the dangers of transnational corporations. Right now, in 2025, there is an awakening to the dangers of oligarchy—when a few billionaires rule the world. In his farewell speech, outgoing President Biden left us with this warning:

*Today, an oligarchy is taking shape in America of extreme wealth, power and influence that literally threatens our entire democracy, our basic rights and freedoms, and a fair shot for everyone to get ahead. We see the consequences all across America.*

When my book warning of the corporate problem was released in 1995, the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) had recently passed, followed by the formation of the World Trade Organization (WTO). The world began to realise that for-profit corporations were surpassing democratic governments as society’s most powerful governing institutions. The book quickly became an international bestseller.

The extraordinary information technology breakthroughs since 1995 produced the billionaires who currently control them. The world is now witnessing [an alliance](https://abcnews.go.com/US/trump-tapped-unprecedented-13-billionaires-top-administration-roles/story?id=116872968) of tech and financial billionaires that has taken control of the administrative, judicial, and legislative branches of the world’s most powerful government.

Their clear intention is to use that control to defend and further advance their personal monetary interests in disregard of consequences for the wellbeing of Earth and society—and especially the interests of members of the struggling working class whose votes put the billionaires in power. We must use this latest awakening to create a deeply democratic future free of extremes of wealth and power.

Following World War II, the world arrived at a significant moment of opportunity when decolonisation spawned a temporary global burst of democracy and a drive to create and share prosperity equitably on a global scale. The commitment to economic development sparked hope that assets and power would henceforth be democratically sh…

[Truncated preview: showing 358 words out of ~1306. Full content available via `btf_extract_evidence`.]", "word_count": 1306, "snippet_word_count": 358, "snippet_truncated": true, "date_cutoff_start": "2025-02-01T11:26:31.016896", "date_cutoff_end": "2025-03-02T11:26:31.016896", "cached_at": "2025-10-24T06:03:20.972260"}
messages.name: btf_fetch_url_content

We are a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.", "question": "Will the median person on Bloomberg's Billionaires Index be from the United States on March 20, 2025?", "background": "On December 28, 2025, the 250th-ranked name on the list was Scott Duncan of the United States.", "resolution_criteria": "This question resolves as **Yes** if the person ranked 250th on the Bloomberg Billionaires Index (available at [this link](https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires/)) is listed as being from the United States, when accessed by Metaculus Admins on or after March 22, 2025. It resolves as **No** if the 250th-ranked person is from any other country.", "fine_print": "For purposes of this question, the "median" from the question's title is defined as the 250th ranked person on the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, no matter how many are on the list.", "present_date": "2025-03-01T11:26:31.016896"}

messages.name: btf_extract_evidence

messages.content:
Based on the information gathered, here are some key points relevant to the question:

1. **Bloomberg Billionaires Index**: The index is updated daily and reflects changes in the markets and economy. As of December 28, 2025, the 250th-ranked person was Scott Duncan from the United States. This suggests that, at least recently, the median billionaire was from the U.S.

2. **Wealth Distribution Trends**: The World Wealth Report and other sources indicate that there have been significant changes in wealth distribution, with a concentration of wealth among a few individuals, many of whom are based in the U.S. The presence of U.S.-based tech and financial billionaires is particularly strong.

3. **Economic and Political Influence**: There is a notable influence of billionaires in the U.S. government and economy, with many of the world's richest individuals being from the U.S. This suggests a strong likelihood that U.S. billionaires will continue to hold significant positions on the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

Given these factors, the probability that the median person on Bloomberg's Billionaires Index will be from the United States on March 20, 2025, is relatively high. The current trends and recent data support the likelihood of a U.S. individual holding the 250th position.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.75
